cab.content: J: EARAFHBAKELSy^Jk^E^ac^trerurraL- ofl%rr- ^aland" to theSecretary of State for the Colonies. (Received Colonial Office, 6.15 a.m. 24th March., 1920),Treaty. Government of New Zealand adopts the same position as the Canadian Government but it desires to leave it absolutely to the discretion of Imperial Government whether a protest against the terms of the Lenroot reservation should be made to the United States, The force of the reasons against present action as set forth in the latter part of your telegram is appreciated "by my Government.oWith ref&rance to your cipher telegram of March 13th. United States Senate reservation toLIVERPOOL".
